market.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a time when people buy and sell goods, food etc, or the place, usually outside or in a large building, where this happens
market.translation[0].definitions[0].not: street market (=with a lot of different people selling things from tables, stalls etc in the street)
market.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: I usually buy all my vegetables at the market.
There’s a good antiques market here on Sundays.
market.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a shop that sells food and things for the home
market.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a particular country or area where a company sells its goods or where a particular type of goods is sold
market.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Our main overseas market is Japan.
The domestic market makes up about 75% of their sales.
The world’s largest market for illegal drugs is the US.
market.translation[0].definitions[3].def: the number of people who want to buy something, or the type of people who want to buy it
market.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Is there a market for his invention?
The market for specialist academic books is pretty small.
market.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to try to persuade people to buy a product by advertising it in a particular way, using attractive packages etc
market.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: If you could ever figure out how to market this, you’d make a fortune.
They plan to market the toy for children aged 2 to 6.
Electric cars are being marketed as safe for the environment.
market.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to make a product available in shops
market.translation[2].definitions[0].def: the activity of buying and selling goods or services, or the value of the goods or services sold
market.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The babyfood market is worth many tens of millions of pounds a year.
Fast food is certainly a growth market (=one that is increasing in size).
Futures will tend to be overpriced in a rising market and underpriced in a falling market.
the booming market (=a profitable one with lots of activity) for mobile communications
heavy losses on apartment loans in states with depressed markets (=ones with falling prices and not much activity)
Harley has captured (=obtained) about 60% of  the market for the biggest bikes.
market.translation[2].definitions[1].def: a particular country, area, or group of people to which a company sells or hopes to sell its goods or services
market.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: Our main overseas market is Japan.
a magazine aimed at the teenage market
The company is entering the Hawaiian market as part of its nationwide expansion.
Import rules could make it hard for foreign van suppliers to penetrate that market (=to manage to enter it).
market.translation[2].definitions[2].exa: companies with drugs on the market or in the final stages of product-testing
They put their apartment on the market (=offered it for sale) for $300,000.
market.translation[2].definitions[3].def: the number of people who want to buy something
market.translation[2].definitions[3].exa: The market for specialist academic books is pretty small.
He’s been trying to determine if there is a market for his invention.
market.translation[2].definitions[4].def: the economic system in which prices, jobs, wages etc depend on what people want to buy, how much they are willing to pay etc
market.translation[2].definitions[4].exa: We should not leave credit card interest rates to the market - Congress should act.
market.translation[2].definitions[5].def: if a seller corners the market, they own or produce most of the goods on sale, and can therefore set prices
market.translation[2].definitions[5].exa: A trader may deliberately set out to corner the market in a product.
market.translation[2].definitions[6].def: to ask for so much money for something or for your services that no one wants to buy it or employ you
market.translation[2].definitions[6].exa: Supermodels are pricing themselves out of the market.
market.translation[2].definitions[7].def: the buying and selling of shares, bonds, COMMODITIES etc, or a place where this happens. Some markets are in a particular building, while trading on others takes place on computers and over the telephone, with no central building
market.translation[2].definitions[7].exa: The markets (=financial markets in general) here have improved and the economy is strong.
Fear of war shook financial markets around the world.
market.translation[2].definitions[8].def: to be ready to buy and sell particular shares, bonds etc at particular prices
market.translation[2].definitions[8].exa: Each company is assigned a dealer who is responsible for making a market in the stock.
market.translation[2].definitions[9].def: if a price bucks the market trend, it goes in the opposite direction to most of the other prices in the market
market.translation[2].definitions[9].exa: Among shares that bucked the market’s downward trend, EMI finished 4p higher.
market.translation[2].definitions[10].de: if someone cannot buck the market, they cannot avoid the effects of the market as a whole, for example by making money when everyone else is losing it
market.translation[2].definitions[11].de: to risk money on a financial market
market.translation[2].definitions[11].ex: One way to play the European markets is through publicly traded mutual funds.
market.translation[2].definitions[12].de: a time when people buy and sell goods, or the place, usually outside or in a large building, where this happens
market.translation[2].definitions[12].ex: A market is held in the town square every Friday.
market.translation[3].definitions[0].def: to sell something or make it available for sale, especially in a particular way
market.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: Toshiba’s consumer electronics products were previously marketed in Italy through a distributor.
market.translation[3].definitions[1].def: to sell something by considering what customers want or need when buying a product or service, for example how much they are willing to pay, where they will buy it etc
market.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: The company has marketed its services well with a highly visible media campaign.
